articles.headline: Oregon lands No. 1 safety Washington, nephew of Kobe Bryant
articles.description: Four-star prospect Jett Washington, ESPN's No. 1 safety in the 2026 class, announced his commitment to Oregon over Alabama and USC on Thursday night.

articles.headline: Brandon Arrington, No. 1 athlete prospect in 2026, picks Texas A&M
articles.description: Brandon Arrington, the No. 1 athlete prospect and 14th overall recruit in the 2026 ESPN 300, has committed to Texas A&M.

articles.headline: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
articles.description: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

articles.headline: CFP leaders say 'everything's on the table' after meetings wrap
articles.description: CFP executive director Rich Clark said "pretty much everything's on the table" for potential formats for 2026 and beyond but that the group would like to make a decision by the fall.

article.headline: Woody Marks' TD run with 8 seconds left gives No. 23 USC 27-20 win over No. 13 LSU
article.description: — Lincoln Riley had a flashback to three years ago when he coached Oklahoma.
article.linkText: Woody Marks' TD run with 8 seconds left gives No. 23 USC 27-20 win over No. 13 LSU

images.name: Brian Kelly slams table while discussing LSU's loss to USC
images.caption: LSU head coach Brian Kelly shows his emotions following a frustrating loss against USC.

video.headline: Hudson's one-handed grab sets up USC's go-ahead TD in final seconds
video.caption: After Kyron Hudson makes a sweet one-handed grab, Woody Marks scores from 13 yards out to give USC a 27-20 lead over LSU with just eight seconds remaining.
video.title: Hudson's one-handed grab sets up USC's go-ahead TD in final seconds
video.description: After Kyron Hudson makes a sweet one-handed grab, Woody Marks scores from 13 yards out to give USC a 27-20 lead over LSU with just eight seconds remaining.

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Hudson's one-handed grab sets up USC's go-ahead TD in final seconds) 2024/09/01 ESHEET

article.story: LAS VEGAS -- — Lincoln Riley had a flashback to three years ago when he coached Oklahoma. The Sooners were driving against archrival Texas in a tie game when a 33-yard run into the end zone with 3 seconds left beat the Longhorns. Knowing that a field goal was all No. 23 Southern California needed Sunday night, Riley thought back to that play. A run was called for Woody Marks, who rushed 13 yards up the middle to score with 8 seconds left and beat No. 13 LSU 27-20. “I told someone on the headset, ‘It wouldn’t surprise me if he creases this,'" Riley said. “And, of course, it happened.” Miller Moss passed for 378 yards and a touchdown and his 20-yard completion to Kyron Hudson and a subsequent targeting penalty on LSU with 18 seconds to go set up the winning score by Marks in the season opener for both teams. It was Marks' second TD run. “We worked really hard throughout the offseason to build the identity of a tough team that really cares about each other,” Moss said. Moss outdueled LSU's Garrett Nussmeier, who completed 29 of 38 passes for 304 yards with two touchdowns and an interception on the final drive. Moss was similarly efficient in going 27 of 36 in a battle of QBs who waited their turns after sitting behind the two most recent Heisman Trophy winners, LSU's Jayden Daniels and USC's Caleb Williams. USC, in its first season of Big Ten Conference play, sent a message with this victory in the teams' first meeting in 40 years that the Trojans could be a factor after going a disappointing 8-5 last year. “That was some pretty good Big Ten football today,” Riley said with a smile. And it came against a Southeastern Conference opponent hoping to show it belongs in the College Football Playoff. LSU will still have its chances to make that case, but this is the Tigers' third consecutive season-opening loss under coach Brian Kelly and fifth straight overall. LSU also had its four-game winning streak going back to last season snapped. “We didn't play complementary football,” Kelly said. “But the thing that is most concerning for me are the personal fouls, the penalties that are selfish. They're undisciplined penalties. That falls back on me. We take pride in running a disciplined program, but we have clearly not done a good enough job there because it impacted the game.” The Tigers represented about 60% of the crowd, an Allegiant Stadium announced record gathering of 63,969 that sometimes felt like Baton Rouge West. There was some star power, too, with LSU greats Shaquille O'Neal and Daniels with his Heisman Trophy in tow. Former USC Heisman winners Marcus Allen and Matt Leinart also were on hand. Two tremendous catches helped define the first half. Hudson leapt high and back, reaching his right hand out to somehow bring the ball toward his other hand and into his body for a 24-yard completion to LSU's 19-yard line. The play stood after video review, and it set up a 2-yard touchdown run by Marks to put the Trojans in front 7-0 four minutes into the second quarter. LSU's Kyren Lacy answered with his own acrobatic catch, twisting and just getting his right foot inbound for a 19-yard touchdown to tie the game midway through the period. Both teams also missed opportunities — the Tigers were turned away on downs after driving to the USC 3, and Trojans kicker Michael Lantz missed a 29-yard field goal to the right as the first-half clock expired. The Trojans could've had an extra 30-40 seconds on that final possession, but Riley opted not to call timeout before LSU tied the game on 45-yard field goal by Damian Ramos with 1:08 left. The game went back and forth with the Trojans taking a 20-17 lead with 5:44 left in regulation when Moss found Ja'Kobi Lane for a 28-yard touchdown. A 31-yard field goal from Ramos tied it, but left 1:47 on the clock. It was too much time as Moss led the Trojans on an eight-play, 75-yard drive to win. ------ Get poll alerts and updates on the AP Top 25 throughout the season. Sign up here. AP college football: https://apnews.com/hub/ap-top-25-college-football-poll and https://apnews.com/hub/college-football

videos.headline: Sankey recaps memorable moments, travel from Week 1 of football
videos.description: SEC Commissioner Greg Sankey joins the SEC Now crew and discusses his crazy week of travel, along with his favorite moments from Week 1 of football.

videos.headline: Daniels speaks on Nussmeier's 'gun-slinging mentality'
videos.description: Former LSU QB Jayden Daniels previews what we can expect to see from Garrett Nussmeier and explains how his confident personality is a reflection of his leadership abilities on the field.
